28 TEST(PathPlanning, FindPath) {
29  // Define your nodes and edges
30  std::cout << "STARTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTTT:" << std::endl;
31  PathPlanning pathFinder;
32 
33  // Add nodes and edges to the path planner
34  std::vector<Node> nodes;/* Initialize your nodes */
35  // Add 20 nodes with X and Y coordinates
36  nodes.push_back({0.0, 0.0});
37  nodes.push_back({1.0, 1.0});
38  nodes.push_back({2.0, 2.0});
39  nodes.push_back({3.0, 3.0});
40  nodes.push_back({4.0, 4.0});
41  nodes.push_back({5.0, 5.0});
42  nodes.push_back({6.0, 6.0});
43  nodes.push_back({7.0, 7.0});
44  nodes.push_back({8.0, 8.0});
45  nodes.push_back({9.0, 9.0});
46  nodes.push_back({10.0, 10.0});
47  nodes.push_back({11.0, 11.0});
48  nodes.push_back({12.0, 12.0});
49  nodes.push_back({13.0, 13.0});
50  nodes.push_back({14.0, 14.0});
51  nodes.push_back({15.0, 15.0});
52  nodes.push_back({16.0, 16.0});
53  nodes.push_back({17.0, 17.0});
54  nodes.push_back({18.0, 18.0});
55  nodes.push_back({19.0, 19.0});
56 
57  // Add more nodes here as needed...
58 
59  pathFinder.AutumeticAddingEdge(nodes);
60 
61  // Prompt the user for start and goal nodes
62  Node start = Node(1.2, 1);
63  Node goal = Node(11, 11);
64 
65  // Debug output to check input values
66  std::cout << "Start node: (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ")" << std::endl;
67  std::cout << "Goal node: (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << ")" << std::endl;
68 
69  // Find the closest nodes to the specified coordinates
70  start = pathFinder.FindClosestNode(nodes, start);
71  goal = pathFinder.FindClosestNode(nodes, goal);
72 
73  // Debug output to check closest nodes
74  std::cout << "Closest start node: (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ")" << std::endl;
75  std::cout << "Closest goal node: (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << ")" << std::endl;
76 
77  // Find the shortest path
78  std::vector<Node> path = pathFinder.ShortestPath(start, goal);
79 
80  // Display the path
81  if (!path.empty()) {
82  std::cout << "Shortest path from (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ") to (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << "):" << std::endl;
83  for (const Node& node : path) {
84  std::cout << "(" << node.X << "," << node.Y << ") ";
85  }
86  std::cout << std::endl;
87  } else {
88  std::cout << "No path found from (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ") to (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << ")." << std::endl;
89  }
90 
91  // Debug output to check the path
92  std::cout << "Path size: " << path.size() << std::endl;
93 
94  // Verify that a path is found
95  ASSERT_FALSE(path.empty());
96 
97  // You can add more specific assertions to verify the correctness of the path
98  // For example, check if the path starts at the start node and ends at the goal node
99  EXPECT_EQ(path.size(), 11);
100  EXPECT_EQ(path.front(), start);
101  EXPECT_EQ(path.back(), goal);
102 }

104 // Test case for finding a path
105 TEST(PathPlanning, FindPathWithROSBag) {
106  int argc = 0; // Initialize argc and argv for ROS
107  char** argv = nullptr;
108  // ros::init(argc, argv, "your_node_name");
109  // ros::NodeHandle nh;
110 
111  // Open the ROS bag containing geometry_msgs/PoseStamped messages
112  rosbag::Bag bag;
113  bag.open("/home/connor/catkin_ws/src/Robotics-Studio-1/logs/pointLocation.bag", rosbag::bagmode::Read);
114 
115  PathPlanning pathFinder;
116 
117  // Define nodes and edges as needed
118  std::vector<Node> nodes;
119  // Add nodes and edges here...
120 
121  // Load data from the ROS bag into pathFinder
122  rosbag::View view(bag);
123  for (rosbag::MessageInstance const& msg : view) {
124  geometry_msgs::PoseStamped::ConstPtr pose_msg = msg.instantiate<geometry_msgs::PoseStamped>();
125  if (pose_msg != nullptr) {
126  // Extract the X and Y coordinates from the PoseStamped message
127  double x = pose_msg->pose.position.x;
128  double y = pose_msg->pose.position.y;
129 
130  // Use x and y to create nodes and add them to your path planning graph
131  Node node = {x, y};
132  nodes.push_back(node);
133  }
134  }
135  pathFinder.DrawMap(nodes, 0.5);
136  // Add nodes and edges to the path planner
137  pathFinder.AutumeticAddingEdge(nodes);
138 
139  // Prompt the user for start and goal nodes or use predefined values
140  Node start = nodes.front();
141  Node goal = nodes[15];
142 
143  std::cout << "Start node: (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ")" << std::endl;
144  std::cout << "Goal node: (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << ")" << std::endl;
145 
146  // Modify or remove this part if you want to provide start and goal nodes differently
147  // Find the closest nodes to the specified coordinates
148  start = pathFinder.FindClosestNode(nodes, start);
149  goal = pathFinder.FindClosestNode(nodes, goal);
150 
151  // Debug output to check closest nodes
152  std::cout << "Closest start node: (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ")" << std::endl;
153  std::cout << "Closest goal node: (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << ")" << std::endl;
154 
155  // Find the shortest path
156  std::vector<Node> path = pathFinder.ShortestPath(start, goal);
157 
158  // Display the path
159  if (!path.empty()) {
160  std::cout << "Shortest path from (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ") to (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << "):" << std::endl;
161  for (const Node& node : path) {
162  std::cout << "(" << node.X << "," << node.Y << ") ";
163  }
164  std::cout << std::endl;
165  } else {
166  std::cout << "No path found from (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ") to (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << ")." << std::endl;
167  }
168  std::cout << "\n";
169  std::cout << "\n";
170  pathFinder.DrawMapWithShortestPath(nodes, path, 0.5);
171 
172  // Verify that a path is found
173  // ASSERT_FALSE(path.empty());
174  // EXPECT_EQ(path.front(), start);
175  // EXPECT_EQ(path.back(), goal);
176  bag.close();
177 }

180 // Test case for finding a path
181 TEST(PathPlanning, FindPathWithROSBagWithMultiGoal) {
182  int argc = 0; // Initialize argc and argv for ROS
183  char** argv = nullptr;
184  // ros::init(argc, argv, "your_node_name");
185  // ros::NodeHandle nh;
186 
187  // Open the ROS bag containing geometry_msgs/PoseStamped messages
188  rosbag::Bag bag;
189  bag.open("/home/connor/catkin_ws/src/Robotics-Studio-1/logs/pointLocation.bag", rosbag::bagmode::Read);
190 
191  PathPlanning pathFinder;
192 
193  // Define nodes and edges as needed
194  std::vector<Node> nodes;
195  // Add nodes and edges here...
196 
197  // Load data from the ROS bag into pathFinder
198  rosbag::View view(bag);
199  for (rosbag::MessageInstance const& msg : view) {
200  geometry_msgs::PoseStamped::ConstPtr pose_msg = msg.instantiate<geometry_msgs::PoseStamped>();
201  if (pose_msg != nullptr) {
202  // Extract the X and Y coordinates from the PoseStamped message
203  double x = pose_msg->pose.position.x;
204  double y = pose_msg->pose.position.y;
205 
206  // Use x and y to create nodes and add them to your path planning graph
207  Node node = {x, y};
208  nodes.push_back(node);
209  }
210  }
211  pathFinder.DrawMap(nodes, 0.5);
212  // Add nodes and edges to the path planner
213  pathFinder.AutumeticAddingEdge(nodes);
214 
215  int count = 0;
216  int countError = 0;
217  // Create random device and generator
218  std::random_device rd;
219  std::mt19937 gen(rd());
220  std::uniform_int_distribution<> distrib(0, nodes.size() - 1);
221 
222  while (true){
223 
224  // Generate a random start node
225  Node start = nodes[distrib(gen)];
226 
227  Node goal;
228  do {
229  // Generate a random goal node
230  goal = nodes[distrib(gen)];
231  } while (goal.X == start.X && goal.Y == start.Y); // Ensure the goal is not the same as the start
232 
233  std::cout << "Start node: (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ")" << std::endl;
234  std::cout << "Goal node: (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << ")" << std::endl;
235 
236  // Modify or remove this part if you want to provide start and goal nodes differently
237  // Find the closest nodes to the specified coordinates
238  start = pathFinder.FindClosestNode(nodes, start);
239  goal = pathFinder.FindClosestNode(nodes, goal);
240 
241  // Debug output to check closest nodes
242  std::cout << "Closest start node: (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ")" << std::endl;
243  std::cout << "Closest goal node: (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << ")" << std::endl;
244 
245  // Find the shortest path
246  std::vector<Node> path = pathFinder.ShortestPath(start, goal);
247 
248  // Display the path
249  if (!path.empty()) {
250  std::cout << "Shortest path from (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ") to (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << "):" << std::endl;
251  for (const Node& node : path) {
252  std::cout << "(" << node.X << "," << node.Y << ") ";
253  }
254  std::cout << std::endl;
255  std::cout << "\n";
256  std::cout << "\n";
257 
258  } else {
259  std::cout << "No path found from (" << start.X << "," << start.Y << ") to (" << goal.X << "," << goal.Y << ")." << std::endl;
260  }
261  std::cout << "\n";
262  std::cout << "\n";
263  pathFinder.DrawMapWithShortestPath(nodes, path, 0.5);
264  std::cout << "\n";
265  std::cout << "\n";
266 
267 
268  count ++;
269  if (path.size() == 1) countError ++;
270  if (count == 200)break;
271  }
272 
273  // Verify that a path is found
274  // ASSERT_FALSE(path.empty());
275  // EXPECT_EQ(path.front(), start);
276  // EXPECT_EQ(path.back(), goal);
277  std::cout << "Count error: " << countError << std::endl;
278 
279 
280  bag.close();
281 }
